Description: Body and handle sherd (mended from two fragments and added plaster) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: at base of wall, trace of undetermined decoration to left of part of a vertical dividing band with maeander; brown line at top of cul; handle streaky black on outside, reserved inside; below handle zone, narrow and wide brown bands, the latter with added red line; below, top of one ray; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0098) (phase 2)
